alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:49PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Calhoun, west central Clarendon, southwestern Sumter and northeastern Orangeburg Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 548 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles northwest of Elloree, or 13 miles northeast of Brookdale, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Summerton, Elloree, Santee State Park, Pinewood, Cameron, Paxville, Poplar Creek Landing, Rimini, Creston, Stumphole Landing, Lone Star and Low Falls Landing. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 115 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Central Orangeburg; Clarendon; Southeastern Orangeburg; Sumter
